TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Docking Camera KURS Style Re-Adopted (Fixed in 1.9)

Articles.Content:
I've re-adopted this mod, updated it for the latest versions of KSP.  @DennyTX is the original author of this.  I had adopted it a few years ago, and he came back about 1 1/2 years ago.  At the time I happily turned it back over to him.  Since then it has languished and  Denny has not responded to me at all.  So I've decided to re-adopt this again, this time I will hold on to it.  The mod has been renamed (see the title) to reflect that.  

Currently I've uploaded a version for KSP 1.4.5-1.6.1 to SpaceDock, this should become available in CKAN soon.  This version will NOT work in 1.7.0, I'll be uploading a 1.7.0 version in the next day or so.  The name on Spacedock cannot be changed due to the way that Spacedock works.

Original thread here: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/124475-131-docking-camera-kurs-14feb18/

My previous thread here: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/166305-131-*

Forum rules don't allow me to unlock my old thread

Dependencies

  • Click Through Blocker
  • ToolbarController

Availability

  • Spacedock: https://spacedock.info/mod/1542/Docking camera (KURS)?ga=%3CGame+3102+%27Kerbal+Space+Program%27%3E
  • Source code: https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/DockingCam
  • License: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0

Changes and updates

  • Nightvision and TV shaders are working again
  • TV shader replaced by a CRT shader
  • Updated obsolete code to new standards
  • Removed old Noise shaders, were replaced by code long time ago
  • Changed functionality of aux window when resizing, it now stays the way it is (ie: if open, will reopen when resizing is complete)
  • Added additional larger size
  • Changed camera rotation from 180 to 90 degrees (for the camera part)    
  • Removed extra level of directory from release (removed the OLDD directory)
  • Renamed directory to DockingCamKURS
  • Rewrote the ReadMe.md

Also Im aware this thread is only a few hours old, so I apologize if I sound like im rushing things, I am more than happy to wait if things arnt ready. Im just going off of what I see on spacedock, and after reading the OP it made me go "huu??"

It's a bit confusing, so here is an explanation:

CKAN can't index more than one release of a mod at a time.  This mod actually needs some different code for 1.7 than 1.6.  So what I did was to do a release for 1.6 first, waited for it to be indexed by CKAN, and then bumped the version number and released it for 1.7.

Going forward, CKAN will only see the updates for 1.7, and will continue to use the 1.3.4 release of the mod for any 1.6 installs.  This unfortunately means that newer features will not be seen by users of CKAN.

The good news is that my build systems build versions of the mod for 1.4.5, 1.5.1, 1.6.1 and 1.7.0, they are all available on Github.  So what 1.6 players will need to do in the future will be to first install the mod, and then update it manually from github

Same issue here, KSP 1.7. I had the right version of the mod.

 

I went through the MM logs and saw 

[timestamps] Applying update DockingCamKURS/Parts/MM_KSPCamera/@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleDockingNode],!MODULE[DockingCameraModule]]:Final to Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPort/dockingPort.cfg/PART
// continue to other docking ports...

Then in KSP.log I saw matching logs that indicates some error: 

[LOG 16:50:44.033] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPort/dockingPort/dockingPort2'
[ERR 16:50:44.040] Cannot find a PartModule of typename 'DockingCameraModule'

[LOG 16:50:44.044] PartLoader: Part 'Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPort/dockingPort/dockingPort2' has no database record. Creating.
[LOG 16:50:44.045] DragCubeSystem: Creating drag cubes for part 'dockingPort2'

// Continue to other docking ports...

 

Hopefully this is useful.

Edited May 18, 2019 by TumiliuM

New release, 1.3.5

  • Removed log spam
  • Add check for vessels undocking
  • Fixed check for vessels with cameras nearby
  • Changed default Noise setting to false for docking cameras
  • Added option to use the standard KSP skin
  • Removed Blizzy option from settings page (now controlled by ToolbarController)
  • Added UI scaling
  • Replaced the lower-right button which cycled through the sizes with two new buttons, one to increase and one to decrease the size
  • Added an "x" to close button in upper right
  • Fixed the rotators so they won't overlap in larger windows
  • Changed the KURS Camera Info window to only show data
  • Updated the wording in the window to properly reflect 1 or multiple (putting an s after vessel when appropriate)
  • Added InitWindow() to docking camera Activate()
